content.description: Begin on good but awkward holds deep under on right side of overhang and make difficult move to underclingy flake. Traverse left a little and top out same as Femalien
content.location: deep under right side of overhang

content.description: On the far right side of the Banana boulder. Â Start by sitting down as far to the right as possible. Traverse left along the lip while heel hooking. Crank to a bad sidepull to finish it up.
content.location: If you are facing Eon Blue Apocolypse, walk two boulders to the right. This is the banana boulder. Go to the right side of this boulder and begin on the lowest of the large pockets.

content.description: Traverse right on pocketed face gaining some height until you reach a slopey jug in the middle of a bulge. Make a large move with your right hand to a crack. Sloping but manageable top-out
content.location: Left side of eon blue overhang on pocketed face with small roof a foot or two off the ground. Traverse right to obvious vertical crack in a little dihedral

climbs.name: Mikes Hard Lemonade
climbs.fa: Chris Grosh, Mike Stearns, Elliot Layda

content.description: Fun finish variation to Eon Blue. Begin same as Eon Blue to the big left hand move. Then continue traversing left and move up into the right side of the big sloping hueco. Top out straight up on good diagonal crimp and slopers. Feels about the same as Eon Blue in terms of difficulty.
Squat start on jug under roof. Make a big move left to catch the lip of the overhang. Continue up and left on pockets in dark rock to a pretty chill top out.
content.location: This is located on the Four boulder. If you have located Yes We Have No Bananas, turn around and it's the dark face right behind you.

content.description: Start on low pocket and diagonal right behind a small boulder. Use a shallow hollow crimp rail and head straight up using some small holds. The fall from the upper part is ok if the small boulder is padded and you have a spotter. Black Bible says V4, I thought it was quite harder than that.
content.protection: 2 pads. A spotter might be more important.
content.location: Located on the Banana Boulder. After the Eon Blue Boulder proper, this is the next boulder that you might consider climbing as you walk uphill and south.

content.description: Begin right hand on slopey pocket and left on some sloping crimps. Make tricky and powerful move with your left hand after matching a very bad sloping crimper to another crimpy flake and leap for a very good jug. Match and climb straight up through a heartbreak move to a not so difficult topout.
content.location: Middle of steep overhang on pocket and crimps

content.description: Climb femalien to jug/kneebar then make big span move out left (Photo) and continue straight up the crack
content.location: Start on femalien and finish on eon red

content.description:
Stand Start on crimp/flake in the middle of cave make move to jug/knee-bar then a big span out left to a ok crimp finish straight up on crack

(Sit start goes at v-12 )
content.location: Start crimp/flake finish same as the cauldron

content.description: Start on left facing pockets deep under the overhang and make some tricky and powerful moves left to crimps. From crimps climb continue left and then straight up to sloping jugs in middle of the bulge and finish with a big move to a vertical crack and moderately techy topout
content.location: left side of steepest part of cave. Shares finish holds with the "Unknown V5"

content.description: Begin same as Eon blue, but at first set of crimps make a huge throw for the sloping jug system straight above.
content.location: Same start as eon blue...big pockets on left side of steepest part of the overhang
